metadata.Title: CVE-2020-25696 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the psql interactive terminal of PostgreSQL in versions before 13.1, before 12.5, before 11.10, before 10.15, before 9.6.20 and before 9.5.24. If an interactive psql session uses \gset when querying a compromised server, the attacker can execute arbitrary code as the operating system account running psql. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to data confidentiality and integrity as well as system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-25696` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libecpg-compat3 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libecpg6 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpgtypes3 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libpq5 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-client-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plperl-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-plpython3-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
postgresql-pltcl-10 - 10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: leosilva> PostgreSQL 9.1 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as ignored in precise. PostgreSQL 9.3 is end of life upstream, and no updates are are available. Marking as deferred in -esm-main releases.

criterions.comment: postgresql-10 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '10.15-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
